name: LiberSonora
description: An AI-powered, robust, open-source audiobook toolkit that includes features like intelligent subtitle extraction, AI title generation, multilingual translation, with support for GPU acceleration and batch offline processing

content.overview:
LiberSonora, meaning "Free Voice", is an AI-powered, open-source audiobook toolkit designed to operate entirely offline with GPU acceleration capabilities. The platform solves common audiobook management problems through intelligent subtitle extraction, smart title generation, and multilingual translation support.

Designed with modularity in mind, LiberSonora allows users to leverage specific services independently or as a complete solution, offering flexibility for various audiobook processing needs. The toolkit supports multiple large language models, including local Ollama, DeepSeek, and OpenAI, giving users choice and control over their AI processing requirements.

With its batch processing capabilities, LiberSonora can efficiently handle large quantities of audiobooks, eliminating the need for tedious manual processing. Its support for local audio file processing improves efficiency by removing file transfer steps, while also ensuring complete data privacy and security as all processing happens offline.

The project is developed with the vision of creating a comprehensive audiobook ecosystem, with the current implementation focused on intelligent subtitle extraction, title generation, and multilingual support - core features that transform how users organize, access, and engage with audiobook content.

features.title: Multi-model Selection and Integration
features.description:
LiberSonora offers flexible model selection to meet diverse user needs:
- Support for multiple large language models including local Ollama, DeepSeek, and OpenAI
- Model configuration at the subtask level for optimized performance
- DeepSeek integration for high-quality text generation and translation
- Complete offline operation capability when using local models
- User-friendly interface for model selection and configuration

features.title: Intelligent Subtitle Extraction
features.description:
Transform audio-only content into accessible text with advanced subtitle capabilities:
- High-accuracy speech recognition for precise subtitle generation
- Background noise removal to improve recognition quality
- Subtitle correction using local large models
- Support for lengthy audio files (over 3 hours)
- Subtitle synchronization with audio timestamps
- Format compatibility with standard subtitle formats

features.title: AI Title Generation and Smart Renaming
features.description:
Eliminate meaningless file names and organize your audiobook collection intuitively:
- AI-powered title generation based on content analysis
- Automatic extraction of key themes and topics
- Batch renaming capabilities for efficient library organization
- Manual check and override options for generated titles
- Flexible naming templates and conventions
- Preservation of author information and context

features.title: Multilingual Translation Support
features.description:
Break language barriers with powerful translation capabilities:
- Bilingual subtitle generation using large language models
- High-quality translations that preserve context and meaning
- Support for learning foreign languages through parallel text
- Full support for English audiobooks with translations
- Auto-detection of source language
- Customizable translation settings

features.title: Batch Processing and Workflow Optimization
features.description:
Process entire audiobook libraries efficiently and seamlessly:
- Powerful batch processing for handling multiple audiobooks simultaneously
- Server local audio processing for improved efficiency
- API support for integration into existing workflows
- Containerized deployment for convenient setup
- Independent service testing for quick function verification
- Modular design allowing separate service usage

useCases.title: Personal Audiobook Library Management
useCases.description: Individual audiobook enthusiasts can use LiberSonora to transform their disorganized collection of audiobooks with meaningless filenames (like "Chapter_001.mp3") into a well-structured library with descriptive titles generated by AI. The subtitle extraction feature allows users to quickly search for specific content within audiobooks, while the multilingual translation capabilities make foreign language audiobooks accessible without requiring fluency in the original language.

useCases.title: Language Learning Enhancement
useCases.description: Language learners can leverage LiberSonora to generate bilingual subtitles for audiobooks in their target language. By having both the original text and translation available simultaneously, learners can improve comprehension, pronunciation, and vocabulary. This approach combines the benefits of audio immersion with textual reinforcement, creating an effective language learning environment using authentic literary content.

useCases.title: Academic and Research Applications
useCases.description: Researchers, students, and academics working with audio interviews, lectures, or historical recordings can use LiberSonora to generate accurate transcriptions for analysis and citation. The batch processing capability is particularly valuable for research projects involving large audio datasets, while the offline processing ensures confidentiality for sensitive research materials. The AI title generation helps categorize and organize research materials efficiently.

useCases.title: Content Creation and Distribution
useCases.description: Content creators working with audiobooks can use LiberSonora to generate subtitles for accessibility purposes, making their content available to deaf and hard-of-hearing audiences. Additionally, the multilingual translation feature enables creators to reach international audiences without investing in multiple voice recordings. The batch processing capabilities streamline the workflow for production companies managing large audiobook catalogs.

useCases.title: Educational Resource Development
useCases.description: Educational institutions can utilize LiberSonora to transform audio educational resources into accessible formats with subtitles. For language departments, the bilingual subtitle generation is particularly valuable, allowing the creation of dual-language learning materials from existing audiobooks. The ability to process audio locally ensures compliance with privacy regulations regarding student data and educational content.

advantages.title: Complete Data Privacy and Offline Operation
advantages.description: Unlike cloud-based services, LiberSonora processes all audio and text locally, ensuring that sensitive content never leaves your system, making it ideal for private or confidential materials.

advantages.title: Open Source Freedom and Customization
advantages.description: With its MIT license and truly open-source nature, LiberSonora allows for unlimited customization and integration into existing workflows, without restrictions or concerns about vendor lock-in.

advantages.title: Batch Processing Efficiency
advantages.description: The ability to process multiple audiobooks simultaneously saves significant time compared to manual processing or services that handle files individually, particularly valuable for large collections.

advantages.title: Model Flexibility and Performance Optimization
advantages.description: Users can select different AI models for specific subtasks, optimizing the balance between performance, accuracy, and resource usage according to their particular needs and hardware capabilities.

advantages.title: Multilingual Capabilities without Language Expertise
advantages.description: The built-in translation features enable access to content in foreign languages without requiring fluency, expanding the usability of international audiobook collections.

advantages.title: Containerized Deployment Simplicity
advantages.description: The Docker-based deployment simplifies installation and ensures consistent operation across different systems, reducing setup time and technical barriers.

advantages.title: Modular Architecture for Selective Usage
advantages.description: Users can utilize specific components (like audio enhancement or subtitle recognition) independently, allowing for integration into existing toolchains without adopting the entire solution.

advantages.title: High-Quality Audio Processing
advantages.description: Background noise removal improves both the listening experience and the accuracy of subtitle generation, particularly valuable for historical recordings or content with suboptimal audio quality.

advantages.title: API Support for Workflow Integration
advantages.description: The API interface allows for programmatic integration with other tools and automation of audiobook processing workflows, enhancing productivity for power users and organizations.

advantages.title: Active Development and Community Support
advantages.description: As an actively maintained open-source project with a growing community, LiberSonora continuously improves with new features, model support, and optimizations based on user feedback.

faqs.question: What hardware requirements does LiberSonora have?
faqs.answer: LiberSonora currently requires an NVIDIA GPU environment due to its dependencies on the clear-voice and funasr projects for optimal performance. The minimum recommended specifications include an NVIDIA GPU with at least 4GB of VRAM, 8GB of system RAM, and sufficient storage space for your audiobooks and the Docker containers. CPU-only operation is listed as a low-priority future feature that may not be implemented.

faqs.question: How can I integrate DeepSeek models with LiberSonora?
faqs.answer: DeepSeek integration is available through the multi-model selection interface. After starting the application, navigate to the model selection section, choose DeepSeek as your provider, input your API key, and select the appropriate models for your specific tasks such as subtitle correction, title generation, or translation. The detailed configuration instructions are available in the application's interface.

faqs.question: Can LiberSonora process audiobooks in languages other than English and Chinese?
faqs.answer: Yes, LiberSonora supports multilingual audio processing, though performance may vary depending on the language and the selected AI models. The system currently has optimized support for English and Chinese audiobooks, but can theoretically work with any language supported by the underlying speech recognition and large language models you configure.

faqs.question: Is there a limit to the audiobook length LiberSonora can process?
faqs.answer: LiberSonora supports processing audiobooks over 3 hours in length, which covers most standard audiobooks. For extremely long audiobooks, the system can still process them, but may divide them into manageable segments internally. Processing time will increase proportionally with the length of the audio file.

faqs.question: How accurate is the subtitle generation and translation?
faqs.answer: The accuracy of subtitle generation depends on the audio quality, background noise, and the selected speech recognition model. For clear audio recordings with minimal background noise, accuracy rates can be very high. Translation quality depends on the selected language model - using advanced models like those from DeepSeek generally provides high-quality translations that preserve context and meaning.

faqs.question: Can I use LiberSonora with my existing audiobook management software?
faqs.answer: Yes, LiberSonora is designed to complement existing audiobook management systems. It processes your audio files and generates subtitles and metadata that can be used with other applications. Additionally, its API support allows for integration with custom workflows and other software solutions if you have development resources.

faqs.question: How do I deploy LiberSonora on my system?
faqs.answer: LiberSonora uses Docker for easy deployment. After cloning the repository from GitHub, you can start the application using the provided docker-compose file with the command 'docker-compose -f docker-compose.gpu.yml up -d'. This will set up all necessary services. Detailed installation instructions are available in the project's README file on GitHub.
